`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(r.pre,{children:(0,t.jsxDEV)(r.code,{children:`import { from, HttpLink, ErrorLink, RetryLink } from '@apollo/client';\r
\r
// Create an HTTP link for making HTTP requests\r
const httpLink = new HttpLink({ uri: 'https://api.example.com/graphql' });\r
\r
// Create an error link for handling errors\r
const errorLink = new ErrorLink();\r
\r
// Create a retry link for retrying failed requests\r
const retryLink = new RetryLink();\r
\r
// Create a middleware chain by combining the links\r
const middlewareLink = from([errorLink, retryLink, httpLink]);\r
\r
// Use the middleware chain in Apollo Client\r
const client = new ApolloClient({\r
  link: middlewareLink,\r
  // ...other Apollo Client configurations\r
});\r
\r

`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-2b509819-f64b-40f6-b092-b2088e25fad0.mdx",lineNumber:71,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-2b509819-f64b-40f6-b092-b2088e25fad0.mdx",lineNumber:71,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(r.pre,{children:(0,t.jsxDEV)(r.code,{children:`\r
const customMiddleware = (operation,forward,context) => {\r
  // Intercept and modify the request\r
operation.variables = {...operation.variables, customVariable: 'customValue'}\r
operation.setContext({ headers: { 'X-Custom-Header': 'customValue' } })\r
\r
  // Perform additional actions before forwarding the operation\r
  console.log('Executing custom middleware');\r
\r
\r
  // Forward the operation to the next middleware\r
return forward(operation).map(response => {\r
// Modify the response if needed\r
response.data = {...response.data, customData: 'customValue'}\r
\r
// Perform additional actions after receiving the response\r
    console.log('Received response in custom middleware');\r
\r
// Return the modified or original response\r
return response\r
})\r
}
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-2b509819-f64b-40f6-b092-b2088e25fad0.mdx",lineNumber:97,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-2b509819-f64b-40f6-b092-b2088e25fad0.mdx",lineNumber:97,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(r.p,{children:`Authentication Middleware:\r
Authentication middleware can be used to add authentication headers or perform authentication checks on each request.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-2b509819-f64b-40f6-b092-b2088e25fad0.mdx",lineNumber:130,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(r.pre,{children:(0,t.jsxDEV)(r.code,{children:`import { ApolloLink, from } from '@apollo/client';\r
\r
const authMiddleware = new ApolloLink((operation, forward) => {\r
  // Retrieve authentication token from storage or session\r
  const token = localStorage.getItem("authToken");\r
\r
  // Add authentication token to request headers\r
  operation.setContext(({ headers = {} }) => ({\r
    headers: {\r
      ...headers,\r
      Authorization: token ? \`Bearer \${token}\` : "",\r
    },\r
  }));\r
\r
  // Forward the operation to the next middleware\r
});
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-2b509819-f64b-40f6-b092-b2088e25fad0.mdx",lineNumber:133,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-2b509819-f64b-40f6-b092-b2088e25fad0.mdx",lineNumber:133,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,t.jsxDEV)(r.pre,{children:(0,t.jsxDEV)(r.code,{children:`\r
const loggingMiddleware = new ApolloLink((operation, forward) => {\r
  // Log request details\r
  console.log("Request:", operation.operationName);\r
  console.log("Variables:", operation.variables);\r
\r
  // Forward the operation to the next middleware\r
  return forward(operation).map((response) => {\r
    // Log response details\r
    console.log("Response:", response.data);\r
\r
    // Return the response\r
    return response;\r
  });\r
});
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-2b509819-f64b-40f6-b092-b2088e25fad0.mdx",lineNumber:155,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-2b509819-f64b-40f6-b092-b2088e25fad0.mdx",lineNumber:155,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`As you already know, GraphQL is a query language for APIs. It is a declarative language, which means that it is easy to write queries. However, it is also a flexible language, which means that it is easy to write queries that are not declarative. This guide will help you to write declarative queries. Until now, you have created a server that returns data. However, you have not used the data in any way. This guide will help you to use the data in a declarative way.\r
GraphQL clients are used to send queries to a GraphQL server. Requests are sent in the form of a query string. The response is returned in the form of a JSON object. The response is a JSON object that contains the data that is requested. Request are made to a GraphQL server using HTTP protocol, so you can use the same client as a client for RESTful APIs.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:13,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:[`IDE's are test tools to check the correctness of your queries. You can define your queries in the IDE and then send them to the server. The server will return the data that is requested if the query is correct. There are a lot of IDEs available.\r
The most popular and the simplest IDE for GraphQL queries is `,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.a,{href:"https://www.graphqleditor.com/",children:"GraphiQL"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:21,columnNumber:62},this),`.\r
The modern clone of GraphiQL is `,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.a,{href:"https://www.electronjs.org/apps/graphql-playground",children:"GraphQL Playground"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:22,columnNumber:33},this),`. The enviroment is cleaner and has some advanced features.\r
The recent one IDE for GraphQL queries is `,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.a,{href:"https://studio.apollographql.com/",children:"Apollo Explorer"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:23,columnNumber:43},this),`.\r

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{children:`import { useState, useEffect } from "react";\r
\r
const FetchedData = () => {\r
  const [country, setCountry] = useState();\r
  const fetchData = async (req, res) => {\r
    try {\r
      const response = await fetch("https://countries.trevorblades.com/", {\r
        method: "POST",\r
        headers: {\r
          "Content-Type": "application/json",\r
        },\r
        body: JSON.stringify({\r
          query: "{countries { name }}",\r
        }),\r
      });\r
      const { data } = await response.json();\r
\r
      const countriesName = [];\r
      data.countries.map((c) => countriesName.push(c.name));\r
      setCountry(countriesName);\r
    } catch (error) {\r
      console.log(error);\r
    }\r
  };\r
\r
  useEffect(() => {\r
    fetchData();\r
  }, []);\r
  const countriesList = country?.map((c, index) => <ul key={index}>{c}</ul>);\r
  return (\r
    <>\r
      <h1>Countries</h1>\r
      {countriesList}\r
    </>\r
  );\r
};\r
\r
export default FetchedData;

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{children:`import { useState, useEffect, useCallback } from "react";\r
import { request, gql } from "graphql-request";\r
\r
const FetchedData = () => {\r
  const [country, setCountry] = useState();\r
\r
  const countriesQuery = gql\`\r
    query {\r
      countries {\r
        name\r
      }\r
    }\r
  \`;\r
\r
  const url = "https://countries.trevorblades.com/";\r
\r
  const fetchData = useCallback(async () => {\r
    try {\r
      const response = await request(url, countriesQuery);\r
\r
      const { countries } = response;\r
\r
      const countryName = countries?.map((c, i) => <ul key={i}>{c.name}</ul>);\r
      setCountry(countryName);\r
    } catch (error) {\r
      console.log(error);\r
    }\r
  }, [countriesQuery]);\r
\r
  useEffect(() => {\r
    fetchData();\r
  }, [fetchData]);\r
\r
  return (\r
    <>\r
      <h1>Countries</h1>\r
      {country}\r
    </>\r
  );\r
};\r
\r
export default FetchedData;
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:173,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:173,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{children:`import FetchedData from "./FetchData";\r
import { GraphQLClient, ClientContext } from "graphql-hooks";\r
\r
const client = new GraphQLClient({\r
  url: "https://countries.trevorblades.com/"\r
});\r
\r
export default function App() {\r
  return (\r
      <ClientContext.Provider value={client}>\r
        <FetchedData />\r
      </ClientContext.Provider>\r
  );\r
}

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{children:`import { useState, useEffect, useCallback } from "react";\r
import { useQuery } from "graphql-hooks";\r
\r
const FetchedData = () => {\r
  const [country, setCountry] = useState();\r
\r
  const countriesQuery = \`\r
    query {\r
      countries {\r
        name\r
      }\r
    }\r
  \`;\r
\r
  const { loading, error, data } = useQuery(countriesQuery);\r
\r
  const fetchData = useCallback(async () => {\r
    try {\r
\r
      const { countries } = data;\r
      console.log(countries);\r
\r
\r
      const countryName = countries?.map((c, i) => <ul key={i}>{c.name}</ul>)\r
      setCountry(countryName);\r
    } catch (error) {\r
      console.log(error);\r
    }\r
  }, [data]);\r
\r
  useEffect(() => {\r
    fetchData();\r
  }, [fetchData]);\r
\r
  if (loading) return <p>Loading...</p>;\r
  if (error) return <p>Error: {error.message}</p>;\r
\r
  return (\r
    <>\r
      <h1>Countries</h1>\r
      {country}\r
    </>\r
  );\r
};\r
\r
export default FetchedData;\r

      {countriesList}\r
    </div>\r
  );\r
};\r

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{children:`import { request } from "graphql-request";\r
import useSWR from "swr";\r
\r
const FetchedData = () => {\r
  const countriesQuery = \`\r
    query {\r
      countries {\r
        name\r
      }\r
    }\r
  \`;\r
\r
  const url = "https://countries.trevorblades.com/";\r
\r
  const fetcher = () => request(url, countriesQuery);\r
\r
  const { data, error } = useSWR(countriesQuery, fetcher);\r
\r
  if (error) return <div>failed to load</div>;\r
  if (!data) return <div>loading...</div>;\r
\r
  const countriesList = data?.countries.map((c, i) => <ul key={i}>{c.name}</ul>);\r
\r
  return (\r
    <>\r
      <h1>Countries</h1>\r
      {countriesList}\r
    </>\r
  );\r
};\r
\r
export default FetchedData;
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:388,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:388,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{children:`import { request } from "graphql-request";\r
import { useQuery } from "react-query";\r
\r
const FetchedData = () => {\r
  const countriesQuery = \`\r
    query {\r
      countries {\r
        name\r
      }\r
    }\r
  \`;\r
\r
  const url = "https://countries.trevorblades.com/";\r
\r
  const fetcher = () => request(url, countriesQuery);\r
\r
  const { isLoading, error, data } = useQuery(url, fetcher);\r
\r
  if (error) return <div>failed to load</div>;\r
  if (isLoading) return <div>loading...</div>;\r
\r
  const countriesList = data?.countries.map((c, i) => <ul key={i}>{c.name}</ul>);\r
\r
  return (\r
    <>\r
      <h1>Countries</h1>\r
      {countriesList}\r
    </>\r
  );\r
};\r
\r
export default FetchedData;

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`Relay is a GraphQL client which is built by Facebook. It is a great GraphQL client, but it is not a good choice for simple applications and beginners. It is highly opinionated, users must follow the strict rules.\r
The main thing here is that the error possibility is minimal. Contrary to other clients it misses a lot of flexibility. Relay demands a lot of knowledge about the application and schema design.\r
The shiny point is that it is awesome for scalability. Relay is a complete framework for declarative data fetching.\r
To be able to use Relay, one must create a GraphQL server compatible with Relay.\r
Many developers avoid using Relay and instead use Apollo Client for complex applications, due to its simplicity and flexibility. It is hard to set up compared to other frameworks, but when everything is done, it is less error-prone and can be used in production serving a lot of users.\r
The big advantage of React Relay is that it is supported by Facebook and is tested by millions of users on their social networks. In the new release of React18, the Suspense feature is deeply integrated with Relay. So, if you are using React for your application, with Relay you can get a great performance boost.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:506,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:"Relay is composed of three core parts:"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:515,columnNumber:1},this),`

The runtime features a normalized object cache, optimized "write" and "read" operations, a generic abstraction for incrementally fetching field data (such as for pagination), garbage collection for removing unreferenced cache entries, optimistic mutations with arbitrary logic, support for building subscriptions and live queries, and more.']},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:518,columnNumber:3},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{children:`async function FetchedData() {\r
\r
  const response = await fetch("https://countries.trevorblades.com/", {\r
    method: "POST",\r
    headers: {\r
      "Content-Type": "application/json",\r
    },\r
    body: JSON.stringify({\r
      query: "{countries { name }}",\r
    }),\r
  });\r
\r
  return await response.json();\r
}\r
\r
export default FetchedData;
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:573,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:573,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{children:`import React from "react";\r
import graphql from "babel-plugin-relay/macro";\r
import {\r
  RelayEnvironmentProvider,\r
  loadQuery,\r
  usePreloadedQuery,\r
} from "react-relay/hooks";\r
import RelayEnvironment from "./RelayEnvironment";\r
\r
const { Suspense } = React;\r
\r
\r
const countriesQuery = graphql\`\r
  query AppCountryNamesQuery {\r
    countries {\r
      name\r
    }\r
  }\r
\`;\r
\r
\r
const preloadedQuery = loadQuery(RelayEnvironment, countriesQuery, {\r
  /* query variables */\r
});\r
\r
function App(props) {\r
  const data = usePreloadedQuery(countriesQuery, props.preloadedQuery);\r
console.log(data.countries);\r
      const countriesName = [];\r
      data.countries.map((c) => countriesName.push(c.name));\r
  return (\r
    <div className="App">\r
      <header className="App-header">\r
        {countriesName?.map((c, index) => <ul key={index}>{c}</ul>)}\r
      </header>\r
    </div>\r
  );\r
}\r
\r
function AppRoot() {\r
  return (\r
    <RelayEnvironmentProvider environment={RelayEnvironment}>\r
      <Suspense fallback={"Loading..."}>\r
        <App preloadedQuery={preloadedQuery} />\r
      </Suspense>\r
    </RelayEnvironmentProvider>\r
  );\r
}\r
\r
export default AppRoot;
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:594,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:594,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`At the end of this comprehensive guide, you will learn how to use Apollo Client to fetch data from a GraphQL server.\r
Apollo is a gold standard between the GraphQL ecosystem and React. It's simple, powerful, and flexible. It has a lot of features for modern applications. The downside is the bigger size of the library. It is not convenient to use this "mega" library for a simple application.\r
Apollo is a platform-agnostic client. It can be used with any framework on the client-side, as well as with vanilla JavaScript. Works well with TypeScript and serverless architectures. Works well with Node.js and supports many libraries.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:669,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{children:`import React from 'react'\r
import { ApolloProvider, ApolloClient, InMemoryCache } from "@apollo/client";\r
import { FetchedData } from "./FetchData";\r
\r
const client = new ApolloClient({\r
  uri: "https://countries.trevorblades.com",\r
  cache: new InMemoryCache()\r
});\r
\r
export default function App() {\r
  return (\r
    <ApolloProvider client={client}>\r
      <FetchedData />\r
    </ApolloProvider>\r
  );\r
}
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:683,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:683,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:"FetchData.js:"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:702,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{children:`import React from "react";\r
import { useQuery, gql } from "@apollo/client";\r
\r
const countriesQuery = gql\`\r
  query {\r
    countries {\r
      name\r
    }\r
  }\r
\`;\r
\r
export const FetchedData = () => {\r
  const { loading, error, data } = useQuery(countriesQuery);\r
\r
  if (loading) return <p>Loading ... </p>;\r
  if (error) return <p>Erorr ... </p>;\r
\r
  const countriesList = data.countries.map((country, index) => (\r
    <ul key={index}>{country.name}</ul>\r
  ));\r
  return (\r
    <>\r
      <h1>Countries</h1>\r
      {countriesList}\r
    </>\r
  );\r
};
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:704,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:704,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`The table above shows that GraphQL-request and urql are overall the most balanced libraries. There are no extreme results in any of these two clients.\r
Apollo-client is the most popular client in the community. On the other hand, it has the most issues.\r
GraphQL-hooks is the least popular client in the community. That's not suggesting that is the bad solution for your application.\r
GraphQL-request is the most downloaded client, so it speaks for itself.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:758,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:`Axios, React-Query, and SWR are great tools for any protocol and can be used to build a GraphQL client. My focus is on the protocol-specific GraphQL clients.\r
The GraphQL clients presented in this post, are all pretty solid and have a lot of good features. You can find a lot of comparison tables and examples of how to use the GraphQL clients on the internet. But this post aims to show you practical examples, with the same query and different GraphQL clients. I think that the best way to learn is to try it out on the same workload and see how it works.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-7497de9b-5146-4d75-860e-1a012dca966d.mdx",lineNumber:765,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.pre,{children:(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.code,{children:`const graphql = require('graphql')\r
const {\r
    GraphQLString,\r
    GraphQLObjectType,\r
    GraphQLSchema\r
} = graphql\r
\r
const RootQuery = new GraphQLObjectType({\r
    name: 'RootQueryType',\r
    fields: {\r
      data: {\r
        type: GraphQLString,\r
        resolve(parent, args, context, info) {\r
          return 'Hello World';\r
        },\r
      },\r
    },\r
  })\r
\r
module.exports = new GraphQLSchema({\r
  query: RootQuery,\r
})
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-0ca8f7a7-3844-4349-8956-0b42a94c6b1e.mdx",lineNumber:62,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-0ca8f7a7-3844-4349-8956-0b42a94c6b1e.mdx",lineNumber:62,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.pre,{children:(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.code,{children:`const express = require("express");\r
const { graphqlHTTP } = require("express-graphql");\r
const schema = require("./schema")\r
\r
\r
\r
const app = express();\r
app.use(\r
  "/graphql",\r
  graphqlHTTP({\r
    schema,\r
    graphiql: true,\r
  })\r
);\r
\r
app.listen(4000, () => {\r
  console.log("Running a GraphQL API server at http://localhost:4000/graphql");\r
});
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-0ca8f7a7-3844-4349-8956-0b42a94c6b1e.mdx",lineNumber:110,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-0ca8f7a7-3844-4349-8956-0b42a94c6b1e.mdx",lineNumber:110,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,r.jsxDEV)("br",{},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-0ca8f7a7-3844-4349-8956-0b42a94c6b1e.mdx",lineNumber:147,columnNumber:1},this),`
`,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.pre,{children:(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.code,{children:`const {\r
  GraphQLSchema,\r
  GraphQLObjectType,\r
  GraphQLString,\r
  GraphQLID,\r
  GraphQLList,\r
} = require("graphql");\r
\r
\r
const Users = require("./data/users");\r
const Posts = require("./data/posts");\r
\r
\r
const userType = new GraphQLObjectType({\r
  name: "User",\r
  fields: () => ({\r
    id: { type: GraphQLID },\r
    username: { type: GraphQLString },\r
    email: { type: GraphQLString },\r
    posts: {\r
      type: new GraphQLList(postType),\r
      resolve(parent, args) {\r
        const posts = Posts.filter(\r
          (posts) => posts.user_id === JSON.stringify(parent.id)\r
        );\r
        return posts;\r
      },\r
    },\r
  }),\r
});\r
\r
\r
const postType = new GraphQLObjectType({\r
  name: "Post",\r
  fields: () => ({\r
    id: { type: GraphQLID },\r
    title: { type: GraphQLString },\r
    text: { type: GraphQLString },\r
    user_id: { type: GraphQLID },\r
    user: {\r
      type: userType,\r
      resolve(parent, args) {\r
        const user = Users[parent.user_id - 1];\r
        return user;\r
      },\r
    },\r
  }),\r
});\r
\r
\r
const RootQuery = new GraphQLObjectType({\r
  name: "RootQuery",\r
  fields: {\r
    user: {\r
      type: userType,\r
      args: { id: { type: GraphQLID } },\r
      resolve(parent, args) {\r
        const user = Users[args.id - 1];\r
        return user;\r
      },\r
    },\r
    users: {\r
      type: GraphQLList(userType),\r
      resolve(parent, args) {\r
          const users = Users;\r
        return users;\r
      },\r
    },\r
    post: {\r
      type: postType,\r
      args: { id: { type: GraphQLID } },\r
      resolve(parent, args) {\r
        const post = Posts[args.id - 1];\r
        return post;\r
      },\r
    },\r
    posts: {\r
      type: new GraphQLList(postType),\r
      resolve(parent, args) {\r
        return Posts;\r
      },\r
    },\r
  },\r
});\r
\r
\r
\r
\r
module.exports = new GraphQLSchema({\r
  query: RootQuery,\r
});
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-0ca8f7a7-3844-4349-8956-0b42a94c6b1e.mdx",lineNumber:149,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-0ca8f7a7-3844-4349-8956-0b42a94c6b1e.mdx",lineNumber:149,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.pre,{children:(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.code,{children:`import express from 'express';\r
import { graphqlHTTP } from 'express-graphql';\r
import { GraphQLSchema } from 'graphql';\r
import RootQueryType from './schema/query.js';\r
import RootMutationType from './schema/mutation.js';\r
\r
\r
// Define the schema\r
const schema = new GraphQLSchema({\r
  query: RootQueryType,\r
  mutation: RootMutationType\r
});\r
\r
\r
\r
const app = express();\r
\r
app.use('/graphql', graphqlHTTP({\r
  schema: schema,\r
  graphiql: true,\r
}));\r
\r
const port = process.env.PORT || 8080;\r
\r
app.listen(port, () => {\r
  console.log(\`Running a GraphQL API server at http://localhost:\${port}/graphql\`);\r
});\r
\r
\r

`,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.pre,{children:(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.code,{children:`import {\r
  GraphQLObjectType,\r
  GraphQLID,\r
  GraphQLList,\r
} from 'graphql';\r
import Users from './data/users.js';\r
Import Posts from './data/posts.js';\r
import userType from './types/user.js';\r
import postType from './types/post.js';\r
\r
const RootQueryType = new GraphQLObjectType ({\r
  name: "Query",\r
  fields: () => ({\r
    user: {\r
      type: userType,\r
      args: { id: {type: GraphQLID }},\r
      resolve (parent, args) {\r
        const user = Users [args.id - 1];\r
        return user;\r
      },\r
    },\r
    users: {\r
      type: GraphQLList(userType),\r
      resolve (parent, args) {\r
        const users = Users;\r
        return users;\r
      },\r
    },\r
    post: {\r
      type: postType,\r
      args: {\r
        id: { type: GraphQLID },\r
      },\r
      resolve (parent, args) {\r
        const post = Posts [args.id - 1];\r
        return post;\r
      },\r
    },\r
    posts: {\r
      type: new GraphQLList(postType),\r
      resolve (parent, args) {\r
        const posts = Posts;\r
        return posts;\r
      },\r
    },\r
  }),\r
});\r
\r
\r
export default RootQueryType;

`,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.pre,{children:(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.code,{children:`import { GraphQLNonNull, GraphQLObjectType } from 'graphql';\r
import Users from './data/users.js';\r
import Posts from './data/posts.js';\r
import userType from './types/user.js';\r
import postType from './types/post.js';\r
import { inputUserType, inputPostType } from './types/input.js';\r
\r
\r
const RootMutationType = new GraphQLObjectType ({\r
  name: "Mutation",\r
  fields: () => ({\r
    createUser: {\r
      type: new GraphQLNonNull(userType),\r
      args: {\r
        input: { type: new GraphQLNonNull(inputUserType) },\r
      },\r
      resolve (parent, args) {\r
        const user = {\r
          id: Number(args.input.id),\r
          username: args.input.username,\r
          email: args.input.email,\r
        };\r
        Users.push(user);\r
        return user;\r
      },\r
    },\r
    createPost: {\r
      type: new GraphQLNonNull(postType),\r
      args: {\r
        input: {type: new GraphQLNonNull(inputPostType)},\r
      },\r
      resolve: async (parent, args) => {\r
        const post = {\r
          id: Number(args.input.id),\r
          title: args.input.title,\r
          text: args.input.text,\r
          user_id: Number(args.input.user_id),\r
        };\r
        Posts.push(post);\r
        return post;\r
      },\r
    },\r
  }),\r
});\r
\r
\r
export default RootMutationType;

import Posts from '../../data/posts.js';\r
\r
\r
const userType = new GraphQLObjectType({\r
  name: "User",\r
  fields: () => ({\r
    id: { type: new GraphQLNonNull(GraphQLID) },\r
    username: { type: new GraphQLNonNull(GraphQLString) },\r
    email: { type: new GraphQLNonNull(GraphQLString) },\r
    posts: {\r

        const posts = Posts.filter(\r
          (posts) => posts.user_id === JSON.stringify(parent.id)\r

        return posts;\r
      },\r
    },\r
  }),\r
});\r
\r
export default userType;

});\r

`,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.p,{children:[`Finally, we will learn how to use GraphQL Subscription to get real-time updates from the server.\r
The GraphQL Subscription is a way to get real-time updates from the server. It's used the WebSocket protocol, instead of HTTP, because it's more efficient, two-way communication. The server sends updates to the client, and the client sends updates to the server. `,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.strong,{children:"Subscription"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-61ac5f3d-39fa-408f-8212-ad125604493f.mdx",lineNumber:18,columnNumber:264},this),` means that the client is not required to send a request to the server every time it wants to get an update. } from "graphql";\r
import { PostType } from "./post.js";\r
import { getPost, getPosts } from "../resolvers/resolvers.js";\r
\r
\r
const Query = new GraphQLObjectType({\r
  name: "Query",\r
  fields: () => ({\r
    post: {\r
      type: PostType,\r
      args: {\r
        id: {\r
          type: GraphQLID,\r
        },\r
      },\r
      resolve: (parent, args) => getPost(args.id),\r
    },\r
    posts: {\r
      type: new GraphQLList(PostType),\r
      resolve: () => getPosts(),\r
    },\r
  }),\r
});\r
\r
\r
export default Query;

`,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.pre,{children:(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.code,{children:`import {\r
  GraphQLID,\r
  GraphQLNonNull,\r
  GraphQLObjectType,\r
} from "graphql";\r
import { addPost, updatePost, deletePost } from "../resolvers/resolvers.js";\r
import { PostType } from "./post.js";\r
import { InputPostType } from "./inputPost.js";\r
\r
\r
const Mutation = new GraphQLObjectType({\r
  name: "Mutation",\r
  fields: () => ({\r
    addPost: {\r
      type: new GraphQLNonNull(PostType),\r
      args: {\r
        input: {\r
          type: new GraphQLNonNull(InputPostType),\r
        },\r
      },\r
      resolve: async (parent, args, {pubsub}) => {\r
          const {title, content} = args.input;\r
\r
          return addPost(title, content, pubsub);\r
      }\r
    },\r
    updatePost: {\r
      type: PostType,\r
      args: {\r
        input: {\r
          type: new GraphQLNonNull(InputPostType),\r
        },\r
      },\r
      resolve: async (parent, , {pubsub}) => {\r
            const {id, title, content} = args.input;\r
\r
            return updatePost(id, title, content, pubsub);\r
      },\r
    },\r
    deletePost: {\r
      type: new GraphQLNonNull(PostType),\r
      args: {\r
        id: {\r
          type: new GraphQLNonNull(GraphQLID),\r
        },\r
      },\r
      resolve: (parent, args, {pubsub}) => {\r
          const { id } = args;\r
          return deletePost(id, pubsub);\r
      },\r
    },\r
  }),\r
});\r
\r
\r
export default Mutation;

`,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.pre,{children:(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.code,{children:`import { GraphQLNonNull, GraphQLObjectType } from "graphql";\r
import { PostSubscription } from "./post.js";\r
\r
\r
const Subscription = new GraphQLObjectType({\r
  name: "Subscription",\r
  fields: () => ({\r
    post_added: {\r
      type: new GraphQLNonNull(PostSubscription),\r
      subscribe: (parent, args, {pubsub}) => pubsub.asyncIterator("NEW_POST"),\r
      },\r
    post_updated: {\r
        type: new GraphQLNonNull(PostSubscription),\r
        subscribe: (parent, args, {pubsub}) => pubsub.asyncIterator("POST_UPDATED"),\r
      },\r
    post_deleted: {\r
            type: new GraphQLNonNull(PostSubscription),\r
            subscribe: (parent, args, {pubsub}) => pubsub.asyncIterator("POST_DELETED"),\r
        },\r
    },\r
  }),\r
});\r
\r
\r
export default Subscription;

`,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.pre,{children:(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.code,{children:`import { posts } from "../data/posts.js";\r
\r
// Queries\r
export const getPosts = () => posts;\r
\r
export const getPost = (id) => {\r
  if (id < posts.length) {\r
    return posts[id - 1];\r
  }\r
};\r
\r
\r
// Mutations\r
export const addPost = async (title, content, pubsub) => {\r
  const id = posts.length + 1;\r
  const newPost = {id, title, content};\r
  posts.push(newPost);\r
  await pubsub.publish("NEW_POST", {post_added: newPost});\r
  return newPost;\r
};\r
\r
export const updatePost = async (id, title, content, pubsub) => {\r
  const post = posts.find(post => post.id === parseInt(id));\r
\r
  if (post) {\r
    post.title = title;\r
    post.content = content;\r
  }\r
  await pubsub.publish("POST_UPDATED", {post_updated: post});\r
  return post;\r
};\r
\r
\r
export const deletePost = async (id, pubsub) => {\r
  const post = posts.find(post => post.id === parseInt(id));\r
\r
  if (!post) {\r
      throw new Error("Post not found");\r
  }\r
    posts.splice(posts.indexOf(post), 1);\r
\r
  await pubsub.publish("POST_DELETED", {post_deleted: post});\r
  return post;\r
};
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-61ac5f3d-39fa-408f-8212-ad125604493f.mdx",lineNumber:296,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-61ac5f3d-39fa-408f-8212-ad125604493f.mdx",lineNumber:296,columnNumber:1},this),`

Based on the name, the asyncIterator method of the pubsub object is called and sends the event to the client. In the end, it remains to create a server to implement the subscription.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-61ac5f3d-39fa-408f-8212-ad125604493f.mdx",lineNumber:343,columnNumber:1},this),`

`,(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.pre,{children:(0,r.jsxDEV)(n.code,{children:`import { GraphQLSchema, execute, subscribe } from "graphql";\r
import { WebSocketServer } from "ws";\r
import express from "express";\r
import { graphqlHTTP } from "express-graphql";\r
import { PubSub } from "graphql-subscriptions";\r
import Query from "./types/query.js";\r
import Mutation from "./types/mutation.js";\r
import Subscription from "./types/subscription.js";\r
import expressPlayground from "graphql-playground-middleware-express";\r
import { SubscriptionServer } from "subscriptions-transport-ws";\r
\r
const app = express();\r
const pubsub = new PubSub();\r
const graphQLPlayground = expressPlayground.default;\r
\r
// define the GraphQL schema\r
const schema = new GraphQLSchema({\r
  query: Query,\r
  mutation: Mutation,\r
  subscription: Subscription,\r
});\r
\r
\r
ap.use("/graphql", graphqlHTTP({\r
  schema,\r
  context: { pubsub },\r
}));\r
\r
app.use("/playground", graphQLPlayground({\r
  endpoint: "/graphql",\r
  subscriptionEndpoint: \`/graphql\`,\r
}));\r
\r
\r
const server = app.listen(4000, () => {\r
\r
const wss = new WebSocketServer({\r
    server,\r
    path: "/graphql",\r
});\r
\r
SubscriptionServer.create(\r
    {\r
        schema,\r
        execute,\r
        subscribe,\r
        onConnect: () => {\r
           return { pubsub }\r
        },\r
    },\r
    wss,\r
);\r
\r
\r
\r
  console.log("Server is running on http://localhost:4000");\r
});
`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-61ac5f3d-39fa-408f-8212-ad125604493f.mdx",lineNumber:358,columnNumber:1},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-61ac5f3d-39fa-408f-8212-ad125604493f.mdx",lineNumber:358,columnNumber:1},this),`
